```{r}
#the two default players (add 2 more)

#entirely random
RandomAgent_f <- function(input, parameters, rate){
  choice <- rbinom(1,1,rate)
  return (choice)
}

#WSLS (unchanged)
WSLSAgent_f <- function(prevChoice, feedback){
  if (feedback == 1){
    choice = prevChoice
  } else if (feedback ==0){
    choice = (1 - prevChoice)
  }
  return(choice)
}

#WSLS (switch on wins occasionally)
WSLSAgent_f <- function(prevChoice, feedback, switchProb = 0.3){
  if (feedback == 1){
    if (runif(1) < switchProb){
      choice = (1 - prevChoice)
    } else {
      choice = prevChoice
    }
  } else if (feedback == 0){
        if (runif(1) < 0.15){ #using 15% instead of 30 so they don't consistently change between the feedback
      choice = (prevChoice)
    } else {
      choice = (1 - prevChoice)
    }
  }
  return(choice)
}

```


```{r}
trials <- 120
n_participants <- 100

randomChoice <- (rep(NA,trials))
rate <- 0.5

#random
for (t in seq(trials)){
  randomChoice[t] <- RandomAgent_f(0, 0, rate)
}

d1 <- tibble(trial = seq(trials), choice = randomChoice)
p1 <- ggplot(d1, aes(trial,choice)) + geom_line() + theme_classic()

p1
```

```{r}
#WSLS playing against Random

WSLSChoice <- rep(NA, trials)
WSLSChoice[1] <- RandomAgent_f(0,0, rate)

for (i in 2:trials){
  if (randomChoice[i-1] == WSLSChoice[i-1]){
    feedback = 1
  } else {feedback = 0}
  WSLSChoice[i] <- WSLSAgent_f(WSLSChoice[i-1], feedback)
}

df <- tibble(
  randomChoice,
  WSLSChoice,
  trials = seq(trials),
  feedback = as.numeric(randomChoice == WSLSChoice))
  
ggplot(df) + 
  theme_classic() + 
  geom_line(color = "red", aes(trials, randomChoice)) + 
  geom_line(color = "blue", aes(trials, WSLSChoice))

```


```{r}

#WSLS (change occasionally)

WSLS_switch_Choice <- rep(NA, trials)
WSLS_switch_Choice[1] <- RandomAgent_f(0, 0, rate)

for (i in 2:trials){
  if (randomChoice[i-1] == WSLS_switch_Choice[i-1]){
    feedback = 1
  } else {
    feedback = 0
  }
  WSLS_switch_Choice[i] <- WSLSAgent_f(WSLS_switch_Choice[i-1], feedback, switchProb = 0.3)
}


df <- tibble(
  randomChoice,
  WSLS_switch_Choice,
  trials = seq(trials),
  feedback = as.numeric(randomChoice == WSLS_switch_Choice))
  
ggplot(df) + 
  theme_classic() + 
  geom_line(color = "red", aes(trials, randomChoice)) + 
  geom_line(color = "blue", aes(trials, WSLS_switch_Choice))
```
